hI, I just noticed that you mentioned that they removed your whole thyroid except for a small piece.  I've heard, and am not saying this is the case, cause i'm not a dr, but have heard more stories with people having problems with partial thyroidectomys, than with just removing the whole gland.  Is it possible this small piece is causing you trouble?  I don't know. just a thought. There seems to be alot of other medical issues involved, that maybe could be causing a problem, I guess i'm just confused as to why they would leave such a small piece, as it sounds, why not take the whole thing?  Shannon

question: Last November 15, I had a large substernal goiter removed as well as my thyroid, except for a small piece.  Nov. 16, I was released, given a pain pill and went home.  15 minutes into trip, I became nausous, and vomited a little.  Upon arriving home, my throat started to swell and had to be rushed back to hospital, 40 minute drive away.  I was unconscious by the tme I got there and taken right to surgery with a large hematoma and 3 blood clots.  In intensive care on ventillator for 6 days, sent home on 7th day.I have had many problems since then, including the thyroid piece dying; was checked for thyroid function 3 months after surgery do to not feeling well, fainting;  T3 wa 400!  Put on Levothyroxine, chkd every 8 wks;  started at 25mg, up to 50.  I still have gained 40 lbs, fatgued, out of breath, legs swelling, depression, sleeping problems.I have many other health problems, asthma; diabetesII insulin; insulin resistance; arthritis since age 14; hypertension; acid reflux; heart stents (2); adema; fibromyalgia; neuropathy; depression and anxiety.  I have had uterine cancer surgery; two heart stents; and 2 thyoid surgeries in 2 years.  Total Mess!! On top of that I'm a smoker and 125 lbs overweight.  HELP!  I was told before surgery by my doctor, if I had this surgery I would feel so much better.  Probably not have asthma as goiter was pressing on lungs and heart; probably not have diabetes; wouldn't cough as much (caugh more, choke)! Throat tickles and causes caughing when I yawn or lay down.  What's wrong?
title: thyroidectomy complications
